title: Quickstart Guide for Akira Docs
description: This guide will help you get up and running with Akira Docs in just a few minutes.
author: Anonymous

blocks.content: Welcome to the Akira Docs Quickstart Guide!

This guide will help you get up and running with Akira Docs in just a few minutes. Follow the steps below to set up your environment, install the necessary packages, and start using Akira Docs for your documentation needs.
Before you begin, ensure that you have the following installed on your system:

Node.js: Version 16 or higher.
To verify your Node.js installation, run the following command in your terminal:
```bash
node -v
```
Follow these steps to install Akira Docs:

Clone the Repository:
```bash
git clone https://github.com/your-org/akira-docs-template
```
Navigate to the Project Directory:
```bash
cd akira-docs-template
```
Install Dependencies:
```bash
npm install
```
Run the Development Server:
```bash
npm run dev
```
To create a simple documentation page, you can modify the existing template files.

Create a New Markdown File:
In the `docs` directory, create a new file named `my-first-doc.md`.
Add Content:
Open `my-first-doc.md` and add the following content:
```markdown
---
title: My First Document
author: Your Name
publishDate: 2024-11-10
---
# Welcome to My First Document
This is a simple example of a documentation page using Akira Docs.
```
View Your Document:
Save the file and refresh your browser at `http://localhost:3000`. You should see your new document listed.
Now that you have a basic setup, consider exploring the Akira Docs features to enhance your documentation experience.
